LanguageAndText

Class TextFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • LanguageAndText.TextFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITextFacade

    public class TextFacade
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITextFacade
    This class is a realisation of ITextFacade and handles the different property files with objects of TextResourceBundle. In these the file is loaded and accessed for finding the property names. The methods like getButtonText(String) are just passing the request to the responsible textBundles.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    ITextFacade, TextResourceBundle

      • getInstance

        public static TextFacade getInstance()
        Singleton-method to get the only instance of this class. If no one exists a new object is created and returned.
        Specified by:
        getInstance in interface ITextFacade
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of this class

      • setLocalisation

        public boolean setLocalisation(java.util.Locale newLocalisation)
        This method is used to set a new localisation (language and country). In the first part it will be tested if every textBundle supports a property file with the given localisation. If just one of them does not, the localisation will be not set and the return value is false. Otherwise the localisation of all textBundles will be updated to the new one.
        Specified by:
        setLocalisation in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        newLocalisation - localisation, to which it should be set.
        Returns:
        If the localisation could be set to the new one (given in parameter newLocalisation), this method returns true. Otherwise the return value is false. A possible reason for this are missing files or wrong localisation.

      • setLocalisation

        public boolean setLocalisation(java.lang.String language,
                               java.lang.String country)
        This method is similar to setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation), but takes as parameters the language and country as string. These are converted to a Locale-object and calls setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation) taking this object as input.
        Specified by:
        setLocalisation in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        language - The new language to which it should be set.
        country - The new country to which it should be set.
        Returns:
        If the localisation is successfully set, this return value is true. Otherwise it´s false.
        See Also:
        setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation)

        public java.lang.String getButtonText(java.lang.String buttonName)

      • getButtonText

        public java.lang.String getButtonText(ViewActions action)
        This method is similar to getButtonText(String), but converts the given ViewActions to a string. This string serves as the parameter looking for in the button-properties file. Usually used for buttons which take standard names for their action.
        Specified by:
        getButtonText in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        action - Action for which the property should be return
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given action
        See Also:
        getButtonText(String), ViewActions

      • getDialogText

        public java.lang.String getDialogText(java.lang.String dialogName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter dialogName in the dialog-properties file. Used for the description messages in Dialogs like IErrorDialog and IWarningDialog.
        Specified by:
        getDialogText in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        dialogName - Property name for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants, IErrorDialog, IWarningDialog

      • getDialogText

        public java.lang.String getDialogText(java.lang.String dialogName,
                                      java.lang.String[] placeholderReplacer)
        In addition to ITextFacade.getDialogText(String) the returned string is examined for placeholders like {PLACEHOLDER0} and replaces them with the given ones in placeholderReplacer. The number behind the placeholder-tag defines the index in the array.
        Specified by:
        getDialogText in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        dialogName - Property name for which the value is returned
        placeholderReplacer - Array of strings with which the placeholder should be replaced. The index specifies the concrete placeholder {PLACEHOLDERINDEX}.
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name with replaced placeholders
        See Also:
        ITextFacade.getDialogText(String)

      • getParameterText

        public java.lang.String getParameterText(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter parameterName in the parameter-properties file. Used for the description of text fields in formula views like IFRequirementEditView.
        Specified by:
        getParameterText in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        parameterName - Property name for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants

      • getTitleText

        public java.lang.String getTitleText(java.lang.String titleName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter titleName in the title-properties file. Used for the titles in all kind of IView.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:

      • convertStringToNumber

        public java.lang.Number convertStringToNumber(java.lang.String stringToParse)
        Parses a string to a number within a specific Locale. The given string parameter will be parsed to a Number object from which the client can get different types of numbers (int, double, float etc.). While doing this the current location is taken into account which was set by ITextFacade.setLocalisation(Locale). This is done to deal with e.g. double values independently of a language (european: "5,2" english: "5.2").
        Specified by:
        convertStringToNumber in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        stringToParse - String which should be parsed
        Returns:
        The parsed Number object. If it could not be parsed a null value will be returned.

      • convertDoubleToString

        public java.lang.String convertDoubleToString(double doubleToParse)
        Converts a double to a string within a specific Locale. The given double value will be converted taking the current location in account. This method is the counterpart to ITextFacade.convertStringToNumber(String) and similar to ITextFacade.convertIntegerToString(int).
        Specified by:
        convertDoubleToString in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        doubleToParse - Double value which should be converted to string
        Returns:
        String converted from given double

      • convertIntegerToString

        public java.lang.String convertIntegerToString(int integerToParse)
        Converts an integer to a string within a specific Locale. The given integer value will be converted taking the current location in account. This method is the counterpart to ITextFacade.convertStringToNumber(String) and similar to ITextFacade.convertDoubleToString(double).
        Specified by:
        convertIntegerToString in interface ITextFacade
        Parameters:
        integerToParse - Integer value which should be converted to string
        Returns:
        String converted from given integer
